item.title: What's New for OpenAPI with .NET 9
item.description: Developers in the .NET ecosystem have been writing APIs with ASP.NET and ASP.NET Core for years, and OpenAPI has been a popular choice for documenting those APIs. OpenAPI at its core is a machine-readable document that describes the endpoints available in an API. It contains information not only about parameters, requests and responses, but also additional metadata such as descriptions of properties, security-related metadata, and more.
